content: Hi everyone, i am a software engineer for web and mobile apps with expereince in Java and python .I have interest in systems programming using rust.
How do I remove ra-lsp from vscode. it's buggy and obnoxious and I want it gone
Sorry it's causing you problems :heart: It is still pretty experimental. I don't know the answer to your question, but @matklad might.
(Maybe worth documenting..? I didn't see it in a quick search, but possibly I didn't look hard enough.)
@alex it's a usual vs code extension, so it can be removed via extensions menu. The name is ra-lsp. We probably should rename that to rust-analyzer....

Hello, My name is Serhiy. Sometimes peoples called me as Serhio or Stan. I have worked with C, Bash, Python. Have experience as QA and Unix administrator. at this moment I'm interested in concurrency programming.
Hi Serhiy! You may want to take a look at crossbeam and rayon. If you have any questions, you may want to look at https://www.rust-lang.org/community to find where to ask. Good luck!

Hello, my name is Nick. I'm 24 and from Sydney, Australia. I use python/C, and some JS/R.

Have been learning Rust for a couple of days. Interested in whether Tier 1 support for apple silicon is expected anytime soon?

@ndea7941 Tier 1 support requires a builder capable of running tests for said target. Github actions doesn't provide any apple silicon machines and AFAIK there is nobody willing to sponsor a self-hosted github actions runner for apple silicon.

Thanks. Have also heard back from some in the infrastructure team who have said that machine availability is probably less of an issue now, what is more needed is someone with the want/wherewithal to take on the CI
